itemDescription: British Member of Parliament and military commander

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Robert Lawrence Dundas  (27 July 1780 – 23 November 1844) was a British Whig and military commander during the Peninsular War. He was a Member of Parliament in the House of Commons  representing Malton from 1807–1812, East Retford from 1826–1827, and Richmond from 1828–1834  and from 1839–1841.
